intro: Plethiosphace leistneriana, commonly known as the rock pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa, Namibia, and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, broad oval leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
